page.title: 09SCHOOLING IN NEWHAVEN
page.content: There are four main centres of education in the Newhaven area: a Further Education Centre, three Primary schools and four Playgroups. The Further Education Centre is divided into a tutorial unit, built in 1983, with 20 pupils and 2 teachers, and an Adult Education Centre opened in 1963 with 2,500 students and 55 staff. Adult Education, particularly in crafts, is popular in Newhaven, with 167 different courses offered. Primary schools are: Southdown with 215 pupils: Meeching 170 children and Grays for infants, with 148 pupils. Meeching and Grays opened in 1970. Each school has its own atmosphere and enthusiasms. Southdown, for example, is particularly good at sport. The favourite subjects for most Primary school children are English, Computing and Woodwork.
